¶ MPBasic

¶ extends EventEmitter

¶ Exports: Function

This is a general basic class. It inculdes some methods that are often usefull. It integrates logging, error handling getter/setter, ...

Example:

Config = require( "./path/to/config/module" );
class FooClass extends require( "mpbasic" )( Config )
initialize: =>
    @debug "init"

new FooClass() // -> DEBUG FooClass - Nov 07 2014 15:42:14 - init

 
18
¶

npm modules

 
20  
21  _ = require('lodash')._
22  extend = require('extend')
23  colors = require('colors')
24  
25  
26
¶

define a fallback if no config object has been passed.

 
25  
26  fallbackCnf = 
27    get: ( name, logging = false )->
28  
29      _cnf = {}
30      if logging
31  
32        logging = 
33          logging:
34            severity: process.env[ "severity_#{name}"] or @severity
35            severitys: "fatal,error,warning,info,debug".split( "," )
36        return extend( true, {}, logging, _cnf )
37      else
38        return _cnf
39  
40  module.exports = ( config = fallbackCnf )->
41

¶ constructor

new Baisc( options )

Basic constructor. Define the configuration by options and defaults, init logging and init the error handler

Params
options Object Basic config object 
64  
65      constructor: ( options = {} )->
66        @on "_log", @_log
67  
68        @getter "classname", ->
69          return @constructor.name.toLowerCase()
70  
71        @config = extend( true, {}, @defaults(), config.get( @_config_name or @classname, true ), options )
72

79        return

¶ mixin

mpbasic.mixin( mixins... )

Method to include other class methods to this class.

Params
mixins... Class One or more classes as arguments
API
public

Example:

class Foo
    bar: ->
    console.log( 42 )
    return @

class Lorem extends require( "mpbasic" )()
    constructor: ->
        @mixin( Foo )
    return
        run: -> return 23

new Lorem().bar().run() # -> log: 42 ; return 23

110  
111      mixin: (mixins...)=>
112        if mixins?.length
113          for mxn in mixins
114            for _fnname, fn of mxn.prototype when _fnname isnt "constructor"
115              @[ _fnname ] = fn
116        return
117  
118

¶ _waitUntil

basic._waitUntil( method[, key][, context] )

Wrapper method to create a methos thas is only called until the @{key}is true or an event {key} has bin emitted. Usually this is used to generate a method that will wait until the modules/class is ready.

Params
method Function The function to call.
[ String key="ready" ] the key to listen for.
[context={self}] Context The context to lsiten to the key. Per default it is the instance it self @ or this.
API
public 
215  
216      _waitUntil: ( method, key = "ready", context = @ )=>
217        return =>
218          args = arguments
219          if context[ key ]
220            method.apply( @, args )
221          else
222            context.once key, =>
223              method.apply( @, args )
224              return
225          return
226  
227  
228

handle a error

¶ _handleError

basic._handleError( cb, err [, data] )

Baisc error handler. It creates a true error object and returns it to the callback, logs it or throws the error hard

Params
cb Function String Callback function or NAme to send it to the logger as error
err String Error Object Error type, Obejct or real error object
API
private 
239  
240      _handleError: ( cb, err, data = {}, errExnd )=>
241  
242
¶

try to create a error Object with humanized message

 
241  
242        if _.isString( err )
243          _err = new Error()
244          _err.name = err
245          _err.message = @_ERRORS?[ err ][ 1 ]?( data ) or "unkown"
246          _err.statusCode = @_ERRORS?[ err ][ 0 ] or 500
247          _err.customError = true
248        else 
249          _err = err
250  
251        if errExnd?
252          _err.data = errExnd
253  
254        for _k, _v of data 
255          _err[ _k ] = _v
256  
257        if _.isFunction( cb )
258  
259
¶

@log "error", "", _err

 
258  
259          cb( _err )
260        else if _.isString( cb )
261          @log "error", cb, _err
262        else if cb is true
263          return _err
264        else  
265          throw _err
266        return _err
267

¶ log

base.log( severity, code [, content1, content2, ... ] )

write a log to the console if the current severity matches the message severity

Params
severity String Message severity
code String Simple code the describe/label the output
[contentN] Any Content to append to the log
API
public 
280  
281      log: ( severity, code, content... )=>
282        args = [ "_log", severity, code ]
283        @emit.apply( @, args.concat( content ) ) 
284        return
285

¶ _log

base._log( severity, code [, content1, content2, ... ] )

write a log to the console if the current severity matches the message severity

Params
severity String Message severity
code String Simple code the describe/label the output
[contentN] Any Content to append to the log
API
private 
298  
299      _log: ( severity, code, content... )=>
300  
301
¶

get the severity and throw a log event

 
300  
301        
302        if @_checkLogging( severity )
303          _tmpl = "%s %s - #{ new Date().toString()[4..23]} - %s "
304  
305          args = [ _tmpl, severity.toUpperCase(), @_logname(), code ]
306  
307          if content.length
308            args[ 0 ] += "\n"
309            for _c in content
310              args.push _c
311  
312          switch severity
313            when "fatal"
314              args[ 0 ] = args[ 0 ].red.bold.inverse
315              console.error.apply( console, args )
316              for arg in args when arg instanceof Error
317                console.log arg.stack
318                return
319              console.trace()
320            when "error"
321              args[ 0 ] = args[ 0 ].red.bold
322              console.error.apply( console, args )
323            when "warning"
324              args[ 0 ] = args[ 0 ].yellow.bold
325              console.warn.apply( console, args )
326            when "info"
327              args[ 0 ] = args[ 0 ].blue.bold
328              console.info.apply( console, args )
329            when "debug"
330              args[ 0 ] = args[ 0 ].green.bold
331              console.log.apply( console, args )
332            else
333      
334        return
335  
336

¶ _checkLogging

basic._checkLogging( severity )

Helper to check if a log will be written to the console

Params
severity String Message severity
Returns
Boolean Flag if the severity is allowed to write to the console
API
private 
450  
451      _checkLogging: ( severity )=>
452        if not @_logging_iseverity?
453          @_logging_iseverity = @config.logging.severitys.indexOf( @config.logging.severity )
454  
455        iServ = @config.logging.severitys.indexOf( severity )
456        if @config.logging.severity? and iServ <= @_logging_iseverity
457          true
458        else
459          false
460  
461  
462

¶ _initErrors

basic._initErrors( )

convert error messages to underscore templates

API
private 
469  
470      _initErrors: =>
471        @_ERRORS = @ERRORS()
472        for key, msg of @_ERRORS
473          if not _.isFunction( msg[ 1 ] )
474            @_ERRORS[ key ][ 1 ] = _.template( msg[ 1 ] )
475      
476        return
477  
478
